
-----------------
Confirmatory test
-----------------

For Acetic acid
---------------
+-------------------------+-------------------------+----------------------+
|      Experiment         |     Observation         |    Inference         |
+=========================+=========================+======================+
| Cacodyl oxide test:     | - Extremely bad odor    |   Acetic acid        |
| Strongly head 1ml       |                         |                      |
| original sample with    |                         |                      |
| small amount of arsenic |                         |                      |
| trioxide and potassium  |                         |                      |
| hydroxide to dryness    |                         |                      |
+-------------------------+-------------------------+----------------------+

For Formic acid
---------------
+-------------------------+-------------------------+----------------------+
| Treat a small amount of | White precipitate       |    Formic acid       |
| the neutral solution of | appears which turns to  |                      |
| O.S. with mercuric      | gray on warming in      |                      |
| chloride solution.      | presence of excess      |                      |
|                         | neutral solution        |                      |
+-------------------------+-------------------------+----------------------+

----------
Conclusion
----------

        - Name of the given compound
        - Structure of the given compound
